content.description: Sit start below the roof and make a difficult slap out to the sloper rail. Climb out the rail to the left, rock over onto the slab and smear your way up the slab.
content.location: Just to the left of Rookie Stripes - a variation goes starting from Rookie Stripes but we never did it.

content.description: Somewhat contrived variation - Start on Rookie Stripes and climb left on the prominent rail and climb straight up the prow on thin crimps to the technical slab.

Sit start on good holds on a shelf, make a few moves out the steep into a positive sloper, slap up and left around the corner and follow crimps up an arête feature eventually escaping onto the slab. Easily the best problem i've climbed on Granite Mountain and a contender for one of the best in the area. This boulder may have been discovered and climbed in the past, not 100% sure so please let me know if anyone claims an ascent prior to 2019.
content.location: From Williamson Valley trailhead, hike south taking the first left at the gate, walk for approximately a mile where you will reach another gate. Continue through the gate to trail 345 (Mint Wash Trail) for another 20 minutes. You will find a small trailside boulder with holds and Rookie Stripes is directly behind, towards the mountain.

content.description: Start on rookie stripes and finish on The Smelter. Lots of moves and a crux near the end. Sick.
content.location: Start on rookie stripes and follows the rails left to finish on The Smelter

content.description: Climb the left arete from obvious start holds. Top out is easy climbing behind a pinyon tree.
This problem climbs the right side of the boulder on awesome juggy holds.
content.location: This boulder is about 200 yards west of Rookie Stripes in a nice flat landing area.

content.description: Start on the left arete and somewhat contrivately climb out and right out the overhanging face to finish on Hakuna matate. This would be an awesome problem if it wasn't such an eliminate.
content.location: 200 yards up and left from Rookie stripes.

content.description: Awesome free standing boulders right off trail 345. Pockets of great stone among the east facing foothills of Granite Mountain. The area gets sun in the morning but gets tons of shade once the sun climbs over and gets blocked by the mountain. Standout problem in the area is Rookie Stripes which gets shade most of the day.
